column4: I think its funny how i got beryl to work on edgy but my stupid wireless card doesnt work
you trying to use ndiswrapper with bcmwl5a on edgy?
from what I read (http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=286924) the ndiswrapper packaged with edgy is broken
haha thats like a punch to the groin is what that is
the solution seems to go to ndiswrapper.sf.net and make the source yourself. Very painful :'(
im a noob, i dont think i can do that but if its not impossible i would ike to
okay Step 1: What does 'making source' mean
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/Ndiswrapper#head-c1ebf95637d110c5f01b9a1383d137f79d8cbddb is what you need to be looking at
that should guide you through it better than I can
you have workspaces, <ctrl><alt>Left/Right/Up/Down to change workspace
how long does it take before i can start writing these guides instead of blindly typing them into my console
not too long, you'll pick most of them up pretty quickly
Okay i got stuck - im on part 4.4 that says building deb packages, its not letting me do it int he terminal
did you read the note, you shouldn't need to do that
im not too fond of reading
